dt: {bc}the back part or section of something {bc}{sx|rear end||1}

dt.t: As he was leaving the pits, he lost control of the {wi}back end{/wi} of his car and slid across the patch of grass that separates the pit road exit from the track.

dt.t: With the Roth IRA, you get your tax reward on the {wi}back end{/wi}—you put in already taxed money, but withdrawals are tax free …

dt.t: On Spotify, every song you listen to is categorized … on the {wi}backend{/wi} of the streaming platform.

dt.t: He bred no cattle, but bought in about 120 Irish beasts and Shorthorn {d_link|stirks|stirk} out of Westmorland and Cumberland in spring and at the {wi}back end{/wi} of the year, and fed them out in the stalls.

dt.t: You need to know all the {wi}back-end{/wi} fees when you go to turn in a lease, things like excess mileage that can really zing you.
